columns.dc:description: The name of the organisation to which the data relates.
A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) which identifies the organisation.
Date at which the information provided is true, in the ISO international date format YYYY-MM-DD.
Level within the organisation that the post relates to. 1 for top level (i.e. Chief Executive), 2 for second level (i.e. Corporate Director), 3 for third level (e.g. Directors/Strategic Leads) etc.
Job title of the post the individual holds.
Name of the individual for those senior officers whose salary is 150,000 GBP and over, otherwise NA (Not Applicable).
The individual's pay grade. 'Spot salary' means there is no grading structure for this role.
The name of the directorate to which the individual belongs. The Chief Executive post is above the directorate level and so is listed as 'Chief Executive'.
The name of the service to which the individual belongs. NA (Not Applicable) for the Chief Executive and individuals at level 2 as they do not belong to a service.
Whether the contract is permanent or temporary.
Whether the post is 'Shared' with another organisation or NA (Not Applicable) if not.
Email address to contact the individual - generic address if the individual is not named.
The maximum salary for the grade in GBP.
Whether the post is currently 'Vacant' or NA (Not Applicable) if not.
Additional information providing extra clarity about an individual's post or NA (Not Applicable).
